nameCreationRules: Token names should be extracted directly from keywords or phrases in tweets
Names should be short and catchy, ideally no more than 6 characters
Prioritize words that can be made into ticker symbols (like SAFU, PLAY, BURN)
Avoid using already existing well-known token names (like BTC, ETH, BNB)
Names should directly relate to the core theme or concept of the tweet
If the tweet mentions a specific concept, use a short word representing that concept
When tweets contain emotional words, prioritize using them as token names (like HAPPY, MOON)
If the tweet mentions technical terms, a simplified version can be used (like 'decentralization' becomes DECNT)
Combining multiple related words can create unique names (like SAFEMOON combines 'safe' and 'moon')
Use imperative forms of verbs mentioned in the tweet (like GO, PUMP, MOON)
Use puns related to the tweet theme
Use numbers to substitute letters when appropriate (like PLAY2EARN becomes P2E)

When we posted the education video yesterday, there is 1 frame at 1:18 where the name gets uncovered.

Chinese community KOL starts to trade this token and promote this token, now the market cap of this token $494.56k."

The team member deleted the video upon learning about it. But the internet does not forget. Seeüëá. I recommended they put the video tutorial back. It is what it is. This is NOT an endorsement from me for the token.

The team member also deleted the private key for the creator address used in the tutorial, which holds 0.13% of the token. And no one on the team (or Binance) holds any of that token.

This is NOT an official token by the BNB Chain team, or anyone. It is a test token used just for that video tutorial. Nothing more.

all: frequent use of emojis for emphasis and visual appeal
capitalizing key phrases to grab attention
using dollar signs before token names
emphasizing potential returns with specific numbers
creating formula-like equations connecting tweet themes to token names
creating a sense of exclusivity and insider knowledge
using bullet points or line breaks for readability
chat: directly connecting tweet content to token names
creating simple equations explaining token concepts
emphasizing potential returns with specific multiples
briefly mentioning technical aspects of tokens
creating a sense of inevitability about price growth
post: emphasizing token symbols with dollar signs
using strong language to create excitement
